column5: {50094: '[TextBlock(text=\'[\\n  {\\n    "sid": "50094",\\n    "Technique ID": "T1557",\\n    "Technique name": "Adversary-in-the-Middle",\\n    "Quotes": ["\\\'Adversaries may attempt to position themselves between two or more networked devices using an adversary-in-the-middle (AiTM) technique to support follow-on behaviors such as Network Sniffing, Transmitted Data Manipulation, or replay attacks (Exploitation for Credential Access)\\\'"],\\n    "Explanation": "The Snort rule detects an HTTP attack attempt involving the Responder poisoner, which is a tool used for performing LLMNR/NBT-NS poisoning attacks. This type of attack involves positioning the attacker as a man-in-the-middle between the victim and a legitimate server, allowing them to intercept and manipulate network traffic, which aligns with the Adversary-in-the-Middle technique."\\n  }\\n]\', type=\'text\')]'}
column6: {50094: '[TextBlock(text=\'[\\n  {\\n    "sid": "50094",\\n    "Technique ID": "T1557",\\n    "Technique name": "Adversary-in-the-Middle",\\n    "Quotes": ["\\\'Adversaries may attempt to position themselves between two or more networked devices using an adversary-in-the-middle (AiTM) technique to support follow-on behaviors such as Network Sniffing, Transmitted Data Manipulation, or replay attacks (Exploitation for Credential Access)\\\'"],\\n    "Explanation": "The Snort rule detects an HTTP attack attempt involving the Responder poisoner, which is a tool used for performing LLMNR/NBT-NS poisoning attacks. This type of attack involves positioning the attacker as a man-in-the-middle between the victim and a legitimate server, allowing them to intercept and manipulate network traffic, which aligns with the Adversary-in-the-Middle technique."\\n  }\\n]\', type=\'text\')]'}
column7: {50094: '[TextBlock(text=\'[\\n  {\\n    "sid": "50094",\\n    "Technique ID": "T1557",\\n    "Technique name": "Adversary-in-the-Middle",\\n    "Quotes": ["\\\'Adversaries may attempt to position themselves between two or more networked devices using an adversary-in-the-middle (AiTM) technique to support follow-on behaviors such as Network Sniffing, Transmitted Data Manipulation, or replay attacks (Exploitation for Credential Access)\\\'"],\\n    "Explanation": "The Snort rule detects an HTTP attack attempt involving the Responder poisoner, which is a tool used for performing LLMNR/NBT-NS poisoning attacks. This type of attack involves positioning the attacker as a man-in-the-middle between the victim and a legitimate server, allowing them to intercept and manipulate network traffic, which aligns with the Adversary-in-the-Middle technique."\\n  }\\n]\', type=\'text\')]'}

column5: {38563: '[TextBlock(text=\'[\\n  {\\n    "sid": "38563",\\n    "Technique ID": "T1056",\\n    "Technique name": "Input Capture",\\n    "Quotes": ["Adversaries may use methods of capturing user input to obtain credentials or collect information"],\\n    "Explanation": "The Snort rule detects activity related to the Win.Trojan.GateKeylogger malware, which is designed to capture user input such as keystrokes to steal sensitive information like credentials. This aligns with the T1056 Input Capture technique, where adversaries employ methods to intercept and record user input data."\\n  },\\n  {\\n    "sid": "38563", \\n    "Technique ID": "T1036",\\n    "Technique name": "Masquerading",\\n    "Quotes": ["Adversaries may attempt to manipulate features of their artifacts to make them appear legitimate or benign to users and/or security tools"],\\n    "Explanation": "The rule mentions that the malware uses a \\\'fake 404 response\\\' to masquerade its communication with the command and control server as a legitimate HTTP error message. This deception tactic aligns with the T1036 Masquerading technique, where adversaries manipulate their malicious artifacts to appear benign and evade detection."\\n  }\\n]\', type=\'text\')]'}

column5: {976: '[TextBlock(text=\'[\\n  {\\n    "sid": "976",\\n    "Technique ID": "T1059",\\n    "Technique name": "Command and Scripting Interpreter",\\n    "Quotes": ["\\\'Adversaries may abuse command and script interpreters to execute commands, scripts, or binaries\\\'"],\\n    "Explanation": "The Snort rule is designed to detect attempts to access .bat files, which are batch script files used in Windows to execute commands and scripts. This aligns with the technique of abusing command and scripting interpreters to execute malicious code or commands."\\n  },\\n  {\\n    "sid": "976",\\n    "Technique ID": "T1190",\\n    "Technique name": "Exploit Public-Facing Application",\\n    "Quotes": ["\\\'Adversaries may attempt to exploit a weakness in an Internet-facing host or system to initially access a network\\\'"],\\n    "Explanation": "The rule is specifically looking for access to .bat files on web servers (HTTP_SERVERS), which could indicate an attempt to exploit a public-facing application or server to gain initial access or execute commands."\\n  }\\n]\', type=\'text\')]'}

This aligns with the technique of abusing command and scripting interpreters to execute malicious code or commands."\\n  },\\n  {\\n    "sid": "976",\\n    "Technique ID": "T1190",\\n    "Technique name": "Exploit Public-Facing Application",\\n    "Quotes": ["\\\'Adversaries may attempt to exploit a weakness in an Internet-facing host or system to initially access a network\\\'"],\\n    "Explanation": "The rule is specifically looking for access to .bat files on web servers (HTTP_SERVERS), which could indicate an attempt to exploit a public-facing application or server to gain initial access or execute commands."\\n  }\\n]\', type=\'text\')]'}

This aligns with the technique of abusing command and scripting interpreters to execute malicious code or commands."\\n  },\\n  {\\n    "sid": "976",\\n    "Technique ID": "T1190",\\n    "Technique name": "Exploit Public-Facing Application",\\n    "Quotes": ["\\\'Adversaries may attempt to exploit a weakness in an Internet-facing host or system to initially access a network\\\'"],\\n    "Explanation": "The rule is specifically looking for access to .bat files on web servers (HTTP_SERVERS), which could indicate an attempt to exploit a public-facing application or server to gain initial access or execute commands."\\n  }\\n]\', type=\'text\')]'}

column5: {1129: '[TextBlock(text=\'[\\n  {\\n    "sid": "1129",\\n    "Technique ID": "T1083",\\n    "Technique name": "File and Directory Discovery",\\n    "Quotes": ["\\\'Adversaries may enumerate files and directories or may search in specific locations of a host or network share for certain information within a file system\\\'"],\\n    "Explanation": "The Snort rule is designed to detect attempts to access the .htaccess file, which is a configuration file used by Apache web servers to control access and behavior for specific directories. This activity aligns with the File and Directory Discovery technique, where adversaries enumerate files and directories to gather information or locate specific files of interest."\\n  }\\n]\', type=\'text\')]'}
column6: {1129: '[TextBlock(text=\'[\\n  {\\n    "sid": "1129",\\n    "Technique ID": "T1083",\\n    "Technique name": "File and Directory Discovery",\\n    "Quotes": ["\\\'Adversaries may enumerate files and directories or may search in specific locations of a host or network share for certain information within a file system\\\'"],\\n    "Explanation": "The Snort rule is designed to detect attempts to access the .htaccess file, which is a configuration file used by Apache web servers to control access and behavior for specific directories. This activity aligns with the File and Directory Discovery technique, where adversaries enumerate files and directories to gather information or locate specific files of interest."\\n  }\\n]\', type=\'text\')]'}
column7: {1129: '[TextBlock(text=\'[\\n  {\\n    "sid": "1129",\\n    "Technique ID": "T1083",\\n    "Technique name": "File and Directory Discovery",\\n    "Quotes": ["\\\'Adversaries may enumerate files and directories or may search in specific locations of a host or network share for certain information within a file system\\\'"],\\n    "Explanation": "The Snort rule is designed to detect attempts to access the .htaccess file, which is a configuration file used by Apache web servers to control access and behavior for specific directories. This activity aligns with the File and Directory Discovery technique, where adversaries enumerate files and directories to gather information or locate specific files of interest."\\n  }\\n]\', type=\'text\')]'}

column5: {27967: '[TextBlock(text=\'[\\n  {\\n    "sid": "27967",\\n    "Technique ID": "T1190",\\n    "Technique name": "Exploit Public-Facing Application",\\n    "Quotes": ["\\\'Adversaries may attempt to exploit a weakness in an Internet-facing host or system to initially access a network\\\'"],\\n    "Explanation": "The Snort rule detects a web shell connection attempt, which is a type of malware that exploits vulnerabilities in public-facing web applications to gain initial access to the network."\\n  },\\n  {\\n    "sid": "27967", \\n    "Technique ID": "T1105",\\n    "Technique name": "Ingress Tool Transfer",\\n    "Quotes": ["\\\'Adversaries may transfer tools or other files from an external system into a compromised environment\\\'"],\\n    "Explanation": "The rule is looking for the transfer of a web shell tool (Chopper) from an external system to the compromised web server, which is a form of ingress tool transfer."\\n  }\\n]\', type=\'text\')]'}
column6: {27967: '[TextBlock(text=\'[\\n  {\\n    "sid": "27967",\\n    "Technique ID": "T1190",\\n    "Technique name": "Exploit Public-Facing Application",\\n    "Quotes": ["\\\'Adversaries may attempt to exploit a weakness in an Internet-facing host or system to initially access a network\\\'"],\\n    "Explanation": "The Snort rule detects a web shell connection attempt, which is a type of malware that exploits vulnerabilities in public-facing web applications to gain initial access to the network."\\n  },\\n  {\\n    "sid": "27967", \\n    "Technique ID": "T1105",\\n    "Technique name": "Ingress Tool Transfer",\\n    "Quotes": ["\\\'Adversaries may transfer tools or other files from an external system into a compromised environment\\\'"],\\n    "Explanation": "The rule is looking for the transfer of a web shell tool (Chopper) from an external system to the compromised web server, which is a form of ingress tool transfer."\\n  }\\n]\', type=\'text\')]'}

column5: {29869: '[TextBlock(text=\'[\\n  {\\n    "sid": "29869",\\n    "Technique ID": "T1566",\\n    "Technique name": "Phishing",\\n    "Quotes": ["\\\'Adversaries may send phishing messages to gain access to victim systems\\\'"],\\n    "Explanation": "The rule detects a phishing attack by the Win.Trojan.Napolar malware, which likely involves sending malicious links or attachments disguised as legitimate content to trick users into executing the malware. The rule specifically looks for the string \\\'facebook.com.exe\\\', which could be a lure used in the phishing attack."\\n  },\\n  {\\n    "sid": "29869", \\n    "Technique ID": "T1036",\\n    "Technique name": "Masquerading",\\n    "Quotes": ["\\\'Adversaries may attempt to manipulate features of their artifacts to make them appear legitimate or benign to users and/or security tools\\\'"],\\n    "Explanation": "The presence of \\\'facebook.com.exe\\\' in the rule suggests that the malware is attempting to masquerade as a legitimate Facebook application to appear benign and trick users into executing it."\\n  }\\n]\', type=\'text\')]'}

The rule specifically looks for the string \\\'facebook.com.exe\\\', which could be a lure used in the phishing attack."\\n  },\\n  {\\n    "sid": "29869", \\n    "Technique ID": "T1036",\\n    "Technique name": "Masquerading",\\n    "Quotes": ["\\\'Adversaries may attempt to manipulate features of their artifacts to make them appear legitimate or benign to users and/or security tools\\\'"],\\n    "Explanation": "The presence of \\\'facebook.com.exe\\\' in the rule suggests that the malware is attempting to masquerade as a legitimate Facebook application to appear benign and trick users into executing it."\\n  }\\n]\', type=\'text\')]'}

The rule specifically looks for the string \\\'facebook.com.exe\\\', which could be a lure used in the phishing attack."\\n  },\\n  {\\n    "sid": "29869", \\n    "Technique ID": "T1036",\\n    "Technique name": "Masquerading",\\n    "Quotes": ["\\\'Adversaries may attempt to manipulate features of their artifacts to make them appear legitimate or benign to users and/or security tools\\\'"],\\n    "Explanation": "The presence of \\\'facebook.com.exe\\\' in the rule suggests that the malware is attempting to masquerade as a legitimate Facebook application to appear benign and trick users into executing it."\\n  }\\n]\', type=\'text\')]'}

column5: {31807: '[TextBlock(text=\'[\\n  {\\n    "sid": "31807",\\n    "Technique ID": "T1041",\\n    "Technique name": "Exfiltration Over C2 Channel",\\n    "Quotes": ["\\\'Adversaries may steal data by exfiltrating it over an existing command and control channel\\\'"],\\n    "Explanation": "The Snort rule detects a Trojan (Win.Trojan.Nighthunter) attempting to exfiltrate data over an SMTP channel, which is a common command and control channel used by malware."\\n  },\\n  {\\n    "sid": "31807", \\n    "Technique ID": "T1048",\\n    "Technique name": "Exfiltration Over Alternative Protocol",\\n    "Quotes": ["\\\'Adversaries may steal data by exfiltrating it over a different protocol than that of the existing command and control channel\\\'"],\\n    "Explanation": "The rule is looking for data exfiltration attempts over SMTP, which is an alternative protocol to the typical HTTP/HTTPS channels used for command and control."\\n  }\\n]\', type=\'text\')]'}
